author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Escape The Rugby World Cup With Ryanair!Fly Cardiff To Dublin From Just £19.99Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Escape The Rugby World Cup With Ryanair!Fly Cardiff To Dublin From Just £19.99
Ryanair, Europe’s No 1 airline, today (17 Aug) offered Welsh customers the chance to escape the Rugby World Cup by booking a bargain flight to Dublin this September and October. Ryanair has scheduled over 25 return Dublin-Cardiff flights for the Rugby World Cup, meaning customers can book a break to the Irish capital from just £19.99 one-way.
Welsh customers can book their flights on an improved website and app with mobile boarding passes, carry a free small 2nd carry-on bag, enjoy allocated seats, avail of Family Extra and Business Plus services, and use their personal electronic devices at all stages of their flight, as Ryanair continues to deliver so much more than just the lowest fares – with much more to come. These bargain Dublin flights are available to book until Thursday, 20 th August for travel in September and October.
Ryanair’s Robin Kiely said:
“Ryanair will carry thousands of rugby fans to Wales for the World Cup – and now Welsh customers can escape the rugby fever and bag a bargain trip to Dublin this autumn. We’ve scheduled over 25 extra return flights between Cardiff and Dublin – on 18 th , 19 th and 20 th September, and 10 th , 11 th , 12 th , 16 th , 17 th 18 th and 19 th October – so there’s never been a better time to book that trip to Dublin. Seats will be snapped up quickly so customers should log onto the Ryanair.com website and book their flight today.”
